DOC.brief_summary: Objectives : The aim study ( 1 ) define effectiveness functional nasal surgery Le Fort I osteotomy nasal obstruction objective well subjective evaluation , ( 2 ) determine guideline concomitant functional nasal surgery Le Fort I osteotomy , ( 3 ) explore possible mechanisms functional nasal surgery may reduce nasal obstruction severity . Design : A prospective , single-blnd , randomized trial . Setting : Chang Gung Craniofacial Center Department Otolaryngology ( ENT ) . Patients : A total 80 Taiwanese patient unilateral cleft lip palate dentofacial deformity ( age > 16 female , > 18 male ; 40 experimental 40 control group ) Interventions : In experimental group , patient receive Le Fort I osteotomy septoplasty . In control group , patient receive Le Fort I osteotomy . Measurements : All patient undergo history taking , clinical examination , radioallergosorbent ( RAST ) examination ( surgery ) , standard questionnaire image examination surgery , one week , 1 , 3 , 6 , 12 24 month surgery . To reduce radiation exposure , cone-beam CT perform surgery one week , 12 24 month surgery . Data Analysis : Independent chi-squared test , correlation coefficient repeat measure analysis variance ( ANOVA ) use . Statistical significance assume p value less 0.05 . Key Words : cleft lip palate , nasal septum deviation , Le Fort I osteotomy , septoplasty , effectiveness
